Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֖א אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֑ה וַיְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהוָה֙ אֵלָ֔יו מֵאֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵ֖ד לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vayyiqrāʾ ʾel-mōsheh vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnāi ʾēlāv mēʾōhel mōʿēdh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD called unto Moses, and spake unto him out of the tabernacle of the congregation, saying,

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֞ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְאָמַרְתָּ֣ אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אָדָ֗ם כִּֽי־יַקְרִ֥יב מִכֶּ֛ם קָרְבָּ֖ן לַֽיהוָ֑ה מִן־הַבְּהֵמָ֗ה מִן־הַבָּקָר֙ וּמִן־הַצֹּ֔אן תַּקְרִ֖יבוּ אֶת־קָרְבַּנְכֶֽם׃
Translit: dabbēr ʾel-bənē yisrāʾēl vəʾāmartā ʾalēhem ʾādhām kî-yaqrîv mikkem qorbān laʾdhōnāi min-habbəhēmāh min-habbāqār ūmin-hatṣṣōʾn taqrîvū ʾeth-qorbankhem
English: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, If any man of you bring an offering unto the LORD, ye shall bring your offering of the cattle, even of the herd, and of the flock.

Hebrew: אִם־עֹלָ֤ה קָרְבָּנוֹ֙ מִן־הַבָּקָ֔ר זָכָ֥ר תָּמִ֖ים יַקְרִיבֶ֑נּוּ אֶל־פֶּ֝תַח אֹ֤הֶל מוֹעֵד֙ יַקְרִ֣יב אֹת֔וֹ לִרְצֹנ֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: ʾim-ʿōlāh qorbānō min-habbāqār zākhār tāmîm yaqrîvennū ʾel-pethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh yaqrîv ʾōthō lirtṣōnō lifnē ʾadhōnāi
English: If his offering be a burnt sacrifice of the herd, let him offer a male without blemish: he shall offer it of his own voluntary will at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the LORD.

Hebrew: וְסָמַ֣ךְ יָד֔וֹ עַ֖ל רֹ֣אשׁ הָעֹלָ֑ה וְנִרְצָ֥ה ל֖וֹ לְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָֽיו׃
Translit: vəsāmakh yādhō ʿal rōʾsh hāʿōlāh vənirtṣāh lō ləkhappēr ʿālāv
English: And he shall put his hand upon the head of the burnt offering; and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֛ט אֶת־בֶּ֥ן הַבָּקָ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְ֠הִקְרִיבוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֤ן הַֽכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ אֶת־הַדָּ֔ם וְזָרְק֨וּ אֶת־הַדָּ֤ם עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֨חַ֙ סָבִ֔יב אֲשֶׁר־פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֥הֶל מוֹעֵֽד׃
Translit: vəshāḥaṭ ʾeth-ben habbāqār lifnē ʾadhōnāi vəhiqrîvū bənē ʾaharōn hakkōhanîm ʾeth-haddām vəzārəqū ʾeth-haddām ʿal-hammizbēaḥ sāvîv ʾasher-pethaḥ ʾōhel mōʿēdh
English: And he shall kill the bullock before the LORD: and the priests, Aaron's sons, shall bring the blood, and sprinkle the blood round about upon the altar that is by the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

Hebrew: וְהִפְשִׁ֖יט אֶת־הָעֹלָ֑ה וְנִתַּ֥ח אֹתָ֖הּ לִנְתָחֶֽיהָ׃
Translit: vəhifshîṭ ʾeth-hāʿōlāh vənittaḥ ʾōthāhh linthāḥehā
English: And he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into his pieces.

Hebrew: וְ֠נָתְנוּ בְּנֵ֨י אַהֲרֹ֧ן הַכֹּהֵ֛ן אֵ֖שׁ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ וְעָרְכ֥וּ עֵצִ֖ים עַל־הָאֵֽשׁ׃
Translit: vənāthənū bənē ʾaharōn hakkōhēn ʾēsh ʿal-hammizbēaḥ vəʿārəkhū ʿētṣîm ʿal-hāʾēsh
English: And the sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar, and lay the wood in order upon the fire:

Hebrew: וְעָרְכ֗וּ בְּנֵ֤י אַהֲרֹן֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים אֵ֚ת הַנְּתָחִ֔ים אֶת־הָרֹ֖אשׁ וְאֶת־הַפָּ֑דֶר עַל־הָעֵצִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָאֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translit: vəʿārəkhū bənē ʾaharōn hakkōhanîm ʾēth hannəthāḥîm ʾeth-hārōʾsh vəʾeth-happādher ʿal-hāʿētṣîm ʾasher ʿal-hāʾēsh ʾasher ʿal-hammizbēaḥ
English: And the priests, Aaron's sons, shall lay the parts, the head, and the fat, in order upon the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar:

Hebrew: וְקִרְבּ֥וֹ וּכְרָעָ֖יו יִרְחַ֣ץ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְהִקְטִ֨יר הַכֹּהֵ֤ן אֶת־הַכֹּל֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עֹלָ֛ה אִשֵּׁ֥ה רֵֽיחַ־נִיח֖וֹחַ לַֽיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəqirbō ūkhərāʿāv yirḥatṣ bammāyim vəhiqṭîr hakkōhēn ʾeth-hakkōl hammizbēḥāh ʿōlāh ʾisshēh rēaḥ-nîḥōaḥ laʾdhōnāi
English: But his inwards and his legs shall he wash in water: and the priest shall burn all on the altar, to be a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וְאִם־מִן־הַצֹּ֨אן קָרְבָּנ֧וֹ מִן־הַכְּשָׂבִ֛ים א֥וֹ מִן־הָעִזִּ֖ים לְעֹלָ֑ה זָכָ֥ר תָּמִ֖ים יַקְרִיבֶֽנּוּ׃
Translit: vəʾim-min-hatṣṣōʾn qorbānō min-hakkəsāvîm ʾō min-hāʿizzîm ləʿōlāh zākhār tāmîm yaqrîvennū
English: And if his offering be of the flocks, namely, of the sheep, or of the goats, for a burnt sacrifice; he shall bring it a male without blemish.

Hebrew: וְשָׁחַ֨ט אֹת֜וֹ עַ֣ל יֶ֧רֶךְ הַמִּזְבֵּ֛חַ צָפֹ֖נָה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהוָ֑ה וְזָרְק֡וּ בְּנֵי֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן הַכֹּהֲנִ֧ים אֶת־דָּמ֛וֹ עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֖חַ סָבִֽיב׃
Translit: vəshāḥaṭ ʾōthō ʿal yerekh hammizbēaḥ tṣāfōnāh lifnē ʾadhōnāi vəzārəqū bənē ʾaharōn hakkōhanîm ʾeth-dāmō ʿal-hammizbēaḥ sāvîv
English: And he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before the LORD: and the priests, Aaron's sons, shall sprinkle his blood round about upon the altar.

Hebrew: וְנִתַּ֤ח אֹתוֹ֙ לִנְתָחָ֔יו וְאֶת־רֹאשׁ֖וֹ וְאֶת־פִּדְר֑וֹ וְעָרַ֤ךְ הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֹתָ֔ם עַל־הָֽעֵצִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָאֵ֔שׁ אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translit: vənittaḥ ʾōthō linthāḥāv vəʾeth-rōʾshō vəʾeth-pidhrō vəʿārakh hakkōhēn ʾōthām ʿal-hāʿētṣîm ʾasher ʿal-hāʾēsh ʾasher ʿal-hammizbēaḥ
English: And he shall cut it into his pieces, with his head and his fat: and the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar:

Hebrew: וְהַקֶּ֥רֶב וְהַכְּרָעַ֖יִם יִרְחַ֣ץ בַּמָּ֑יִם וְהִקְרִ֨יב הַכֹּהֵ֤ן אֶת־הַכֹּל֙ וְהִקְטִ֣יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עֹלָ֣ה ה֗וּא אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəhaqqerev vəhakkərāʿayim yirḥatṣ bammāyim vəhiqrîv hakkōhēn ʾeth-hakkōl vəhiqṭîr hammizbēḥāh ʿōlāh hūʾ ʾisshēh rēaḥ nîḥōaḥ laʾdhōnāi
English: But he shall wash the inwards and the legs with water: and the priest shall bring it all, and burn it upon the altar: it is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וְאִ֧ם מִן־הָע֛וֹף עֹלָ֥ה קָרְבָּנ֖וֹ לַֽיהוָ֑ה וְהִקְרִ֣יב מִן־הַתֹּרִ֗ים א֛וֹ מִן־בְּנֵ֥י הַיּוֹנָ֖ה אֶת־קָרְבָּנֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəʾim min-hāʿōf ʿōlāh qorbānō laʾdhōnāi vəhiqrîv min-hattōrîm ʾō min-bənē hayyōnāh ʾeth-qorbānō
English: And if the burnt sacrifice for his offering to the LORD be of fowls, then he shall bring his offering of turtledoves, or of young pigeons.

Hebrew: וְהִקְרִיב֤וֹ הַכֹּהֵן֙ אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וּמָלַק֙ אֶת־רֹאשׁ֔וֹ וְהִקְטִ֖יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה וְנִמְצָ֣ה דָמ֔וֹ עַ֖ל קִ֥יר הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translit: vəhiqrîvō hakkōhēn ʾel-hammizbēaḥ ūmālaq ʾeth-rōʾshō vəhiqṭîr hammizbēḥāh vənimtṣāh dhāmō ʿal qîr hammizbēaḥ
English: And the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off his head, and burn it on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be wrung out at the side of the altar:

Hebrew: וְהֵסִ֥יר אֶת־מֻרְאָת֖וֹ בְּנֹצָתָ֑הּ וְהִשְׁלִ֨יךְ אֹתָ֜הּ אֵ֤צֶל הַמִּזְבֵּ֨חַ֙ קֵ֔דְמָה אֶל־מְק֖וֹם הַדָּֽשֶׁן׃
Translit: vəhēsîr ʾeth-murəʾāthō bənōtṣāthāhh vəhishlîkh ʾōthāhh ʾētṣel hammizbēaḥ qēdhəmāh ʾel-məqōm haddāshen
English: And he shall pluck away his crop with his feathers, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, by the place of the ashes:

Hebrew: וְשִׁסַּ֨ע אֹת֣וֹ בִכְנָפָיו֮ לֹ֣א יַבְדִּיל֒ וְהִקְטִ֨יר אֹת֤וֹ הַכֹּהֵן֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה עַל־הָעֵצִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הָאֵ֑שׁ עֹלָ֣ה ה֗וּא אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəshissaʿ ʾōthō vikhnāfāv lōʾ yavdîl vəhiqṭîr ʾōthō hakkōhēn hammizbēḥāh ʿal-hāʿētṣîm ʾasher ʿal-hāʾēsh ʿōlāh hūʾ ʾisshēh rēaḥ nîḥōaḥ laʾdhōnāi
English: And he shall cleave it with the wings thereof, but shall not divide it asunder: and the priest shall burn it upon the altar, upon the wood that is upon the fire: it is a burnt sacrifice, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD.

Hebrew: וְנֶ֗פֶשׁ כִּֽי־תַקְרִ֞יב קָרְבַּ֤ן מִנְחָה֙ לַֽיהוָ֔ה סֹ֖לֶת יִהְיֶ֣ה קָרְבָּנ֑וֹ וְיָצַ֤ק עָלֶ֨יהָ֙ שֶׁ֔מֶן וְנָתַ֥ן עָלֶ֖יהָ לְבֹנָֽה׃
Translit: vənefesh kî-thaqrîv qorban minḥāh laʾdhōnāi sōleth yihyeh qorbānō vəyātṣaq ʿālehā shemen vənāthan ʿālehā ləvōnāh
English: And when any will offer a meat offering unto the LORD, his offering shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense thereon:

Hebrew: וֶֽהֱבִיאָ֗הּ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹן֮ הַכֹּהֲנִים֒ וְקָמַ֨ץ מִשָּׁ֜ם מְלֹ֣א קֻמְצ֗וֹ מִסָּלְתָּהּ֙ וּמִשַּׁמְנָ֔הּ עַ֖ל כָּל־לְבֹנָתָ֑הּ וְהִקְטִ֨יר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־אַזְכָּרָתָהּ֙ הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חָה אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vehevîʾāhh ʾel-bənē ʾaharōn hakkōhanîm vəqāmatṣ misshām məlōʾ qumətṣō missoltāhh ūmisshamnāhh ʿal kol-ləvōnāthāhh vəhiqṭîr hakkōhēn ʾeth-ʾazkārāthāhh hammizbēḥāh ʾisshēh rēaḥ nîḥōaḥ laʾdhōnāi
English: And he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests: and he shall take thereout his handful of the flour thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense thereof; and the priest shall burn the memorial of it upon the altar, to be an offering made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the LORD:

Hebrew: וְהַנּוֹתֶ֨רֶת֙ מִן־הַמִּנְחָ֔ה לְאַהֲרֹ֖ן וּלְבָנָ֑יו קֹ֥דֶשׁ קָֽדָשִׁ֖ים מֵאִשֵּׁ֥י יְהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəhannōthereth min-hamminḥāh ləʾaharōn ūləvānāv qōdhesh qodhāshîm mēʾisshē ʾadhōnāi
English: And the remnant of the meat offering shall be Aaron's and his sons': it is a thing most holy of the offerings of the LORD made by fire.

Hebrew: וְכִ֥י תַקְרִ֛ב קָרְבַּ֥ן מִנְחָ֖ה מַאֲפֵ֣ה תַנּ֑וּר סֹ֣לֶת חַלּ֤וֹת מַצֹּת֙ בְּלוּלֹ֣ת בַּשֶּׁ֔מֶן וּרְקִיקֵ֥י מַצּ֖וֹת מְשֻׁחִ֥ים בַּשָּֽׁמֶן׃
Translit: vəkhî thaqriv qorban minḥāh maʾafēh thannūr sōleth ḥallōth matṣṣōth bəlūlōth basshemen ūrəqîqē matṣṣōth məshuḥîm basshāmen
English: And if thou bring an oblation of a meat offering baken in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mingled with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.

Hebrew: וְאִם־מִנְחָ֥ה עַל־הַֽמַּחֲבַ֖ת קָרְבָּנֶ֑ךָ סֹ֛לֶת בְּלוּלָ֥ה בַשֶּׁ֖מֶן מַצָּ֥ה תִהְיֶֽה׃
Translit: vəʾim-minḥāh ʿal-hammaḥavath qorbānekhā sōleth bəlūlāh vasshemen matṣṣāh thihyeh
English: And if thy oblation be a meat offering baken in a pan, it shall be of fine flour unleavened, mingled with oil.

Hebrew: פָּת֤וֹת אֹתָהּ֙ פִּתִּ֔ים וְיָצַקְתָּ֥ עָלֶ֖יהָ שָׁ֑מֶן מִנְחָ֖ה הִֽוא׃
Translit: pāthōth ʾōthāhh pittîm vəyātṣaqtā ʿālehā shāmen minḥāh hivʾ
English: Thou shalt part it in pieces, and pour oil thereon: it is a meat offering.

Hebrew: וְאִם־מִנְחַ֥ת מַרְחֶ֖שֶׁת קָרְבָּנֶ֑ךָ סֹ֥לֶת בַּשֶּׁ֖מֶן תֵּעָשֶֽׂה׃
Translit: vəʾim-minḥath marḥesheth qorbānekhā sōleth basshemen tēʿāseh
English: And if thy oblation be a meat offering baken in the fryingpan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.

Hebrew: וְהֵבֵאתָ֣ אֶת־הַמִּנְחָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר יֵעָשֶׂ֛ה מֵאֵ֖לֶּה לַיהוָ֑ה וְהִקְרִיבָהּ֙ אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְהִגִּישָׁ֖הּ אֶל־הַמִּזְבֵּֽחַ׃
Translit: vəhēvēʾthā ʾeth-hamminḥāh ʾasher yēʿāseh mēʾēlleh laʾdhōnāi vəhiqrîvāhh ʾel-hakkōhēn vəhiggîshāhh ʾel-hammizbēaḥ
English: And thou shalt bring the meat offering that is made of these things unto the LORD: and when it is presented unto the priest, he shall bring it unto the altar.

Hebrew: וְהֵרִ֨ים הַכֹּהֵ֤ן מִן־הַמִּנְחָה֙ אֶת־אַזְכָּ֣רָתָ֔הּ וְהִקְטִ֖יר הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חָה אִשֵּׁ֛ה רֵ֥יחַ נִיחֹ֖חַ לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: vəhērîm hakkōhēn min-hamminḥāh ʾeth-ʾazkārāthāhh vəhiqṭîr hammizbēḥāh ʾisshēh rēaḥ nîḥōaḥ laʾdhōnāi

English: As for the oblation of the firstfruits, ye shall offer them unto the LORD: but they shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet savour.

Hebrew: וְהִקְטִ֨יר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן אֶת־אַזְכָּרָתָ֗הּ מִגִּרְשָׂהּ֙ וּמִשַּׁמְנָ֔הּ עַ֖ל כָּל־לְבֹנָתָ֑הּ אִשֶּׁ֖ה לַיהוָֽה׃

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּר֩ עָלָ֨יו הַכֹּהֵ֜ן עַל־חַטָּאת֧וֹ אֲשֶׁר־חָטָ֛א מֵֽאַחַ֥ת מֵאֵ֖לֶּה וְנִסְלַ֣ח ל֑וֹ וְהָיְתָ֥ה לַכֹּהֵ֖ן כַּמִּנְחָֽה׃
Translit: vəkhipper ʿālāv hakkōhēn ʿal-ḥaṭṭāʾthō ʾasher-ḥāṭāʾ mēʾaḥath mēʾēlleh vənislaḥ lō vəhāyəthāh lakkōhēn kamminḥāh
English: And the priest shall make an atonement for him as touching his sin that he hath sinned in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him: and the remnant shall be the priest's, as a meat offering.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnāi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: נֶ֚פֶשׁ כִּֽי־תִמְעֹ֣ל מַ֔עַל וְחָֽטְאָה֙ בִּשְׁגָגָ֔ה מִקָּדְשֵׁ֖י יְהוָ֑ה וְהֵבִיא֩ אֶת־אֲשָׁמ֨וֹ לַֽיהוָ֜ה אַ֧יִל תָּמִ֣ים מִן־הַצֹּ֗אן בְּעֶרְכְּךָ֛ כֶּֽסֶף־שְׁקָלִ֥ים בְּשֶֽׁקֶל־הַקֹּ֖דֶשׁ לְאָשָֽׁם׃
Translit: nefesh kî-thimʿōl maʿal vəḥāṭəʾāh bishghāghāh miqqodhshē ʾadhōnāi vəhēvîʾ ʾeth-ʾashāmō laʾdhōnāi ʾayil tāmîm min-hatṣṣōʾn bəʿerkəkhā kesef-shəqālîm bəsheqel-haqqōdhesh ləʾāshām
English: If a soul commit a trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holy things of the LORD; then he shall bring for his trespass unto the LORD a ram without blemish out of the flocks, with thy estimation by shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering:

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת אֲשֶׁר֩ חָטָ֨א מִן־הַקֹּ֜דֶשׁ יְשַׁלֵּ֗ם וְאֶת־חֲמִֽישִׁתוֹ֙ יוֹסֵ֣ף עָלָ֔יו וְנָתַ֥ן אֹת֖וֹ לַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְהַכֹּהֵ֗ן יְכַפֵּ֥ר עָלָ֛יו בְּאֵ֥יל הָאָשָׁ֖ם וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəʾēth ʾasher ḥāṭāʾ min-haqqōdhesh yəshallēm vəʾeth-ḥamîshithō yōsēf ʿālāv vənāthan ʾōthō lakkōhēn vəhakkōhēn yəkhappēr ʿālāv bəʾēl hāʾāshām vənislaḥ lō
English: And he shall make amends for the harm that he hath done in the holy thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering, and it shall be forgiven him.

Hebrew: וְאִם־נֶ֨פֶשׁ֙ כִּ֣י תֶֽחֱטָ֔א וְעָֽשְׂתָ֗ה אַחַת֙ מִכָּל־מִצְוֺ֣ת יְהוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר לֹ֣א תֵעָשֶׂ֑ינָה וְלֹֽא־יָדַ֥ע וְאָשֵׁ֖ם וְנָשָׂ֥א עֲוֺנֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəʾim-nefesh kî theḥeṭāʾ vəʿāsəthāh ʾaḥath mikkol-mitṣvōth ʾadhōnāi ʾasher lōʾ thēʿāsenāh vəlōʾ-yādhaʿ vəʾāshēm vənāsāʾ ʿavōnō
English: And if a soul sin, and commit any of these things which are forbidden to be done by the commandments of the LORD; though he wist it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear his iniquity.

Hebrew: וְ֠הֵבִיא אַ֣יִל תָּמִ֧ים מִן־הַצֹּ֛אן בְּעֶרְכְּךָ֥ לְאָשָׁ֖ם אֶל־הַכֹּהֵ֑ן וְכִפֶּר֩ עָלָ֨יו הַכֹּהֵ֜ן עַ֣ל שִׁגְגָת֧וֹ אֲשֶׁר־שָׁגָ֛ג וְה֥וּא לֹֽא־יָדַ֖ע וְנִסְלַ֥ח לֽוֹ׃
Translit: vəhēvîʾ ʾayil tāmîm min-hatṣṣōʾn bəʿerkəkhā ləʾāshām ʾel-hakkōhēn vəkhipper ʿālāv hakkōhēn ʿal shighghāthō ʾasher-shāghāgh vəhūʾ lōʾ-yādhaʿ vənislaḥ lō
English: And he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest: and the priest shall make an atonement for him concerning his ignorance wherein he erred and wist it not, and it shall be forgiven him.

Hebrew: אָשָׁ֖ם ה֑וּא אָשֹׁ֥ם אָשַׁ֖ם לַיהוָֽה׃
Translit: ʾāshām hūʾ ʾāshōm ʾāsham laʾdhōnāi
English: It is a trespass offering: he hath certainly trespassed against the LORD.

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר יְהוָ֖ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֥ה לֵּאמֹֽר׃
Translit: vaydhabbēr ʾadhōnāi ʾel-mōsheh lēʾmōr
English: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

Hebrew: נֶ֚פֶשׁ כִּ֣י תֶחֱטָ֔א וּמָעֲלָ֥ה מַ֖עַל בַּיהוָ֑ה וְכִחֵ֨שׁ בַּעֲמִית֜וֹ בְּפִקָּד֗וֹן אֽוֹ־בִתְשׂ֤וּמֶת יָד֙ א֣וֹ בְגָזֵ֔ל א֖וֹ עָשַׁ֥ק אֶת־עֲמִיתֽוֹ׃
Translit: nefesh kî theḥeṭāʾ ūmāʿalāh maʿal baʾdhōnāi vəkhiḥēsh baʿamîthō bəfiqqādhōn ʾō-vithsūmeth yādh ʾō vəghāzēl ʾō ʿāshaq ʾeth-ʿamîthō
English: If a soul sin, and commit a trespass against the LORD, and lie unto his neighbour in that which was delivered him to keep, or in fellowship, or in a thing taken away by violence, or hath deceived his neighbour;

Hebrew: אֽוֹ־מָצָ֧א אֲבֵדָ֛ה וְכִ֥חֶשׁ בָּ֖הּ וְנִשְׁבַּ֣ע עַל־שָׁ֑קֶר עַל־אַחַ֗ת מִכֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֥ה הָאָדָ֖ם לַחֲטֹ֥א בָהֵֽנָּה׃
Translit: ʾō-mātṣāʾ ʾavēdhāh vəkhiḥesh bāhh vənishbaʿ ʿal-shāqer ʿal-ʾaḥath mikkōl ʾasher-yaʿaseh hāʾādhām laḥaṭōʾ vāhēnnāh
English: Or have found that which was lost, and lieth concerning it, and sweareth falsely; in any of all these that a man doeth, sinning therein:

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֮ כִּֽי־יֶחֱטָ֣א וְאָשֵׁם֒ וְהֵשִׁ֨יב אֶת־הַגְּזֵלָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר גָּזָ֗ל א֤וֹ אֶת־הָעֹ֨שֶׁק֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׁ֔ק א֚וֹ אֶת־הַפִּקָּד֔וֹן אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָפְקַ֖ד אִתּ֑וֹ א֥וֹ אֶת־הָאֲבֵדָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָצָֽא׃
Translit: vəhāyāh kî-yeḥeṭāʾ vəʾāshēm vəhēshîv ʾeth-haggəzēlāh ʾasher gāzāl ʾō ʾeth-hāʿōsheq ʾasher ʿāshāq ʾō ʾeth-happiqqādhōn ʾasher hofqadh ʾittō ʾō ʾeth-hāʾavēdhāh ʾasher mātṣāʾ
English: Then it shall be, because he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restore that which he took violently away, or the thing which he hath deceitfully gotten, or that which was delivered him to keep, or the lost thing which he found,

Hebrew: א֠וֹ מִכֹּ֞ל אֲשֶׁר־יִשָּׁבַ֣ע עָלָיו֮ לַשֶּׁקֶר֒ וְשִׁלַּ֤ם אֹתוֹ֙ בְּרֹאשׁ֔וֹ וַחֲמִשִׁתָ֖יו יֹסֵ֣ף עָלָ֑יו לַאֲשֶׁ֨ר ה֥וּא ל֛וֹ יִתְּנֶ֖נּוּ בְּי֥וֹם אַשְׁמָתֽוֹ׃
Translit: ʾō mikkōl ʾasher-yisshāvaʿ ʿālāv lassheqer vəshillam ʾōthō bərōʾshō vaḥamishithāv yōsēf ʿālāv laʾasher hūʾ lō yittənennū bəyōm ʾashmāthō
English: Or all that about which he hath sworn falsely; he shall even restore it in the principal, and shall add the fifth part more thereto, and give it unto him to whom it appertaineth, in the day of his trespass offering.

Hebrew: וְאֶת־אֲשָׁמ֥וֹ יָבִ֖יא לַיהוָ֑ה אַ֣יִל תָּמִ֧ים מִן־הַצֹּ֛אן בְּעֶרְכְּךָ֥ לְאָשָׁ֖ם אֶל־הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translit: vəʾeth-ʾashāmō yāvîʾ laʾdhōnāi ʾayil tāmîm min-hatṣṣōʾn bəʿerkəkhā ləʾāshām ʾel-hakkōhēn
English: And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the LORD, a ram without blemish out of the flock, with thy estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest:

Hebrew: וְכִפֶּ֨ר עָלָ֧יו הַכֹּהֵ֛ן לִפְנֵ֥י יְהוָ֖ה וְנִסְלַ֣ח ל֑וֹ עַל־אַחַ֛ת מִכֹּ֥ל אֲשֶֽׁר־יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה לְאַשְׁמָ֥ה בָֽהּ׃
Translit: vəkhipper ʿālāv hakkōhēn lifnē ʾadhōnāi vənislaḥ lō ʿal-ʾaḥath mikkōl ʾasher-yaʿaseh ləʾashmāh vāhh
English: And the priest shall make an atonement for him before the LORD: and it shall be forgiven him for any thing of all that he hath done in trespassing therein.
